text: Glochidion papenooense, also known by its synonym Phyllanthus papenooense, is a species of tree in the family Phyllanthaceae. It is endemic to the island of Tahiti in the Society Islands of French Polynesia, where it is restricted to wetland habitats.Florence, J. (1997) Flore de la Polynésie française, vol. 1. Paris: Éditions de l'ORSTOM. Because of its rarity, it is protected by law in French Polynesia. ==References== Category:Flora of French Polynesia papenooense Category:Critically endangered plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Glochidion papenooense
